intro: Duthiea senegalensis, commonly known as the Senegalese duthiea, is a flowering plant native to the dry regions of West Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its adaptability to arid conditions, it is sometimes used in traditional medicine and as a source of fiber.
